story.title: From Shandong to Your Table
story.subtitle: A 4-generation recipe that crossed the world to reach Puebla

shandong.title: Shandong, China
shandong.text: Where it all began. Our great-grandparents created the original recipe — passed down through 4 generations for over 100 years.

hongkong.title: Hong Kong
hongkong.text: The family moved to Hong Kong and the recipe became the favorite tradition: sitting together, wrapping dumplings, and eating them fresh.

vancouver.title: Vancouver, Canada
vancouver.text: Our parents brought these flavors to Canada and opened a restaurant. The recipe won hearts across the Pacific.

puebla.title: Puebla, Mexico
puebla.text: Now we make our dumplings right here, with fresh local Puebla ingredients. 100 years of tradition, reinvented with Mexican flavor.

story.narrative: This is how our grandmothers made dumplings: we'd all sit at the table, wrap them together, and cook them on the spot. To preserve that essence, we wrap everything fresh by hand and flash-freeze immediately. No factories. No machines. Just hands, love, and a 100-year recipe.

howToCook.title: How to Cook Them
howToCook.subtitle: Easier than you think — from freezer to plate in minutes
howToCook.warning: ⚡ IMPORTANT: Cook straight from frozen. Never thaw first.

steam.title: Steam
steam.steps: Boil water. Place dumplings in a steamer basket with parchment paper. Cover and steam 7-10 min. Soft and juicy.

panFry.title: Pan Fry (The Favorite)
panFry.steps: Heat oil in a non-stick pan. Place dumplings. Fry until golden on the bottom. Add ½ cup water, cover and let it evaporate. Result: crispy outside, juicy inside.

boil.title: Boil
boil.steps: Boil water in a pot. Add dumplings and gently stir. Cook until they float (~7 min). Drain and serve. Simple and delicious.

airFry.title: Air Fryer
airFry.steps: Preheat air fryer to 180°C/350°F. Lightly spray dumplings with oil. Cook 10-12 min, flipping halfway. Incredibly crispy!

howToCook.chickenNote: Chicken dumplings take 10 minutes in all methods.

what.a: They're little dough pockets filled with meat, vegetables, or both — a traditional Asian dish with over 1,800 years of history. Ours are artisanal, handmade in Puebla with a 100-year family recipe. Think of them as Asian empanadas, but juicier and more versatile.

frozen.q: How long do they last in the freezer?
frozen.a: Up to 3 months, keeping all their flavor and texture. We freeze them immediately after making them to lock in freshness.

refreeze.a: We don't recommend it. Cook them straight from frozen for the best flavor and texture. But don't worry — they only take 7 minutes to prepare.

quantity.a: The large bag (1.2kg) has about 40 dumplings and the small one (600g) about 20. Tip: the large bag serves 4-5 people.

payment.a: Bank transfer, cash on delivery, or card. Whatever works best for you.

delivery.a: Yes! FREE delivery in Lomas de Angelópolis. You can also find us at Arte Sano (Cholula) and La Regiomontana (Zerezotla).

allergens.a: Our dumplings contain gluten (dough), soy, and sesame. The vegan version has NO eggs or meat. Each flavor has specific ingredients — check them in the products section.

authentic.a: 100%. Our recipe is over 100 years old and comes straight from Shandong, China. It traveled through Hong Kong, Vancouver, and now it's made in Puebla. Same family recipe, fresh local ingredients.
